p: Together with glutathione, ascorbic acid is an important component of the Foyer–Halliwell–Assad cycle of plant antioxidative defense [ 58]. The revealed increase in the content of ascorbic acid in shoots of both rye varieties indicates that ascorbic acid plays an important role in cellular ROS homeostasis regulation during rye plants adaptation to crude oil-polluted soil. Sharper change in AsA in Valdai shoots compared to Krona is likely to determine the greater resistance of Valdai variety to moderately oil pollution of the soil.
